notes: mass noun for food; can also mean a pastry in plural

example_sentence_italian: Ho comprato una pasta al bar.
example_sentence_english: I bought a pastry at the café.

notes: plural often used for pastries; 'pasta' as food is usually uncountable
example_sentence_italian: Le paste sul vassoio sono fresche.
example_sentence_english: The pastries on the tray are fresh.

example_sentence_italian: Le paste sono state comprate al bar.
example_sentence_english: The pastries were bought at the café.

notes: indefinite plural; 'delle' = di + le; commonly refers to pastries
example_sentence_italian: Ho comprato delle paste per la festa.
example_sentence_english: I bought some pastries for the party.

example_sentence_italian: La salsa della pasta è saporita.

example_sentence_english: Add the sauce to the pasta.

example_sentence_italian: Ho dato le paste alle amiche.
example_sentence_english: I gave the pastries to my friends.

example_sentence_italian: Ho tolto i pinoli dalla pasta.
example_sentence_english: I removed the pine nuts from the pasta.

example_sentence_italian: Ho preso una briciola dalle paste.
example_sentence_english: I took a crumb from the pastries.
There's a shell in the pasta.
I found sugar in the pastries.
Put some cheese on the pasta.

example_sentence_italian: Ho messo la glassa sulle paste.
example_sentence_english: I put the icing on the pastries.

example_sentence_italian: Mangio gli spinaci con la pasta.
example_sentence_english: I eat spinach with the pasta.

example_sentence_italian: Con le paste serviamo anche il caffè.
example_sentence_english: With the pastries we also serve coffee.

notes: not used: 'col' = con + il (masculine); incorrect with feminine 'la'
example_sentence_italian: Col pasta non è corretto in italiano standard.
example_sentence_english: 'Col pasta' is not correct in standard Italian.

notes: not used: 'coi' = con + i (masculine plural); incorrect with feminine 'le'
